page.title: 14SOCIAL LIFE-BLEWBURY
page.content: THE BARLEY MOW,LONDON ROAD:FIRST MENTIONF THIS AS A PUBLIC HOUSE IS IN 1814.THE OLD THATCHED BARLEY MOW WAS BURNT DOWN IN 1929. THE LOAD OF MISCHIEF,SOUTH STREET:HAS BEEN AN INN PERHAPS LONGER THAN ANY OTHER IN THE VILLAGE.THE LARGE UPPER ROOM IS SAID TO HAVE BEEN BUILT SPECIFICALLY TO PROVIDE FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BLEWBURY CLUB.PERHAPS THEMOST INTERESTING FEATURE OF THE "MISCHIEF"IS ITS SIGN,WHICH IS SAID TO HAVE BEEN COPIED FROM ONE BY HOGARTH ENTITLED"THE MAN LOADED WITH MISCHIEF" TEA ROOM,SOUTH STREET:BEFORE IT BECAME A TEA ROOM,THE BUILDING WAS JUST A COTTAGE.IT IS ABOUT TWO HUNDRED YEARS OLD AND WAS CONVERTED ABOUT THIRTY YEARS AGO.THE RESIDENT-OWNER PROVIDES AFTERNOON TEAS AND ANTIQUE CROCKERY, GLASSWARE,GREETING CARDS AND PAINTINGS ARE DISPLAYED FOR SALE.
